Key Match Events: Corbin Carroll hit a game-winning grand slam in the bottom of the eighth inning
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets had a one-run lead in the bottom of the eighth inning but Edwin Díaz walked the first two batters and allowed Corbin Carroll to hit a game-winning grand slam
Brandon Nimmo acknowledged that they have an uphill battle in the National League wild-card race
Manager Carlos Mendoza mentioned that they felt good about their chances with their closer Edwin Díaz on the mound
Miscellaneous Highlights: Luis Severino was hit by a line drive in the third inning and limped around the mound
Joc Pederson hit a two-run moon shot to right in the third inning
Corbin Carroll added his first homer of the evening an inning later, a no-doubter to right-center
